Raskolnikov: “I did not even use the money.”

<setup: dimly lit room, heavy silence>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “Two murders... and I forgot the door!”

Lawyer: “Your mental state matters here.”

Raskolnikov: “I wanted to confess, to be free.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confessed to murder driven by poverty and remorse, which influenced the leniency of his sentence.
